publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-1278# Sarah Boyack: UN World Environment Day 2004-That the Parliament notes that 5 June 2004 marks United Nations World Environment Day with the theme for 2004 as "Wanted! Seas and Oceans - Dead or Alive?"; recognises that oceans cover around 70% of the earth's surface; understands that, according to UN figures, more than 80% of all pollution in seas and oceans comes from land-based activities; notes that sea levels have risen between 10 and 25 centimetres in the past 100 years; recognises that if the world's ice melts then oceans will rise by up to 66 metres; acknowledges the threat to the Scottish coastlines if sea levels continue to rise; further notes the commitments made at the World Summit on Sustainable Development in Johannesburg to tackle the threats to human health and to the world's ecosystems resulting from global warming and pollution, and considers that the Scottish Executive should reinvigorate the work to tackle global climate change. Supported by: Mr Alasdair Morrison*, Cathie Craigie*, Mr Kenneth Macintosh*, Ms Wendy Alexander*, Des McNulty*, Margaret Jamieson*, Elaine Smith*, Donald Gorrie*, Christine May*, Dr Sylvia Jackson*, Marlyn Glen*
